thread.title: Arsene Wenger warns Chelsea his angry Arsenal side are ready to put things right after Watford defeat

author: dwright
title: Arsene Wenger warns Chelsea his angry Arsenal side are ready to put things right after Watford defeat

organizations.name: boca juniors conte speaks antonio conte

text:
we'll be ready Arsene Wenger warns Chelsea his angry Arsenal side are ready to put things right after Watford defeat 
Gunners boss says his hurting players are aiming to go to Stamford Bridge and beat Blues for second time this season By DUNCAN WRIGHT Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ARSENE WENGER has warned Chelsea his hurting Arsenal players are determined to put right the wrongs of their shock defeat to Watford. 
Wenger accused his players of lacking mental strength after their slipped to 2-1 defeat to the Hornets that has blown a hole in their title hopes. PA:Press Association 2 Arsene Wenger has warned Chelsea his players are set on righting the wrongs of their defeat to Watford 
But he says his Gunners stars are itching to get out at Stamford Bridge and beat Antonio Conte’s side for a second time this season. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Arsenal news , gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Wenger said: “We are of course frustrated and angry but I am confident in their self belief to go and win this game. EPA 2 Arsenal were left stunned when they suffered a shock home defeat to Watford 
“You are not at that level if you don’t care about losing, these guys are highly concerned and disappointed when they don’t win. 
“I believe the most important thing is we turn up, we have shown we can beat Chelsea in the first game so let’s turn up with the same quality. 
“What is at stake here is how we respond, in a united and determined way. 
“Naturally we would be more on alert than we were against Watford. We are more likely to be on the edge of our concentration. Saturday Premier League match preview featuring Chelsea v Arsenal 
"That’s competition, when you accept that and want to be at the highest level you have to accept you have defining moments and games. 
"If you don’t want that then it’s better you don’t compete – go and work in adminstration or something like that. 
"Everybody knows we have to recover, the team is united and there is a desire to put things right and everyone is focused on tomorrow’s game."
